parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To announce beforehand, promise, predict. From pro and kataggello; to anounce beforehand, i.e. Predict, promise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A coming, arrival, advent. From the alternate of erchomai; an advent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A betrayer, traitor. From prodidomi (the enemy's) hands); a surrender.
And, even, also, namely.
A murderer.
